definition[0]: to praise someone in order to please them or get something from them, even though you do not mean it
example[0]: Perry would always flatter Mrs. Mitchell by praising her cooking.
definition[1]: to make someone look as attractive as they can
example[1]: That dress really flatters your figure.
definition[2]: to make something look or seem more important or better than it is
example[2]: Lewis’s novel doesn’t flatter Midwestern attitudes and morals.
